summary: This is a memorandum from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary interview with Kimana Cale, a staff member at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, conducted on August 5, 2021. The interview is part of the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York in August 2019. The memorandum lists numerous attachments including interview transcripts, assignment rosters, logs, and count documentation from the time of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein

Daniel, as a Special Agent for the OIG, conducted a voluntary interview of Cale alongside Senior Special Agent Matulewicz.
Cale was a staff member at MCC New York where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was housed and died, making Cale a subject of the OIG investigation into that death.

events.title: OIG Interview of Kimana Cale
events.description: Senior Special Agent Dennis Matulewicz and Special Agent Daniel from the DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary, recorded interview of BOP staff member Kimana Cale regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Death Investigation Documentation
events.description: The memorandum references numerous MCC New York documents from August 9-10, 2019, including assignment rosters, logs, and inmate counts, which are attached as evidence related to the investigation into Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
Boston Area Office (DOJ OIG Reporting Office)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) was actively investigating the death of Jeffrey Epstein in August 2021, conducting interviews with MCC New York staff.
Kimana Cale, a BOP staff member at MCC New York, was voluntarily interviewed on August 5, 2021, and the interview was recorded and transcribed.

The investigation file includes extensive documentation from MCC New York around the time of Epstein's death in August 2019, including daily assignment rosters, lieutenant's logs, housing records, and inmate count sheets.
The document is an internal OIG memorandum that contains no recommendations or conclusions, and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
